Article No. 285
20160108
2016-01-08 随手札记

早上听到隔壁台子的小孩念晨报，说中国股市下跌震惊了全球市场，导致欧美股市大跌。不要这样乃衣服啊！Spx自身也到了技术调整的临界点，2015的年线是绿的哇。
早上x总发威了，“扔扔扔扔扔！！！”
QT来了！Mother fuck！总是搞缩写。Quatitive tightening
早上起来没想到t，金都涨这么多，知道下午才知道原因“when a PBoC advisor called for a further 15% devaluation in CNY”。但是境内媒体，包括彭博都没有查到出处和原文
1.FTN关于今晚NFP
 Economists are a little brain dead when it comes to forecasting December payroll totals.  Estimates are unchanged from November. The question is whether traders still want to trade the results after the first four days battling the madness of 2016.  Because the market has been unable to trade the Fed this week due to oppressive equity volatility, look for bond investors to respond to the one number they can’t ignore – average hourly earnings vs November.
经济学家预测12月nfp着实死了不少脑细胞。估计值同11月。问题在于交易员们在经历了疯狂的头四天大战后，还想就nfp做点差价。因为股市沉重压力，本周市场没能拿fed说故事呢，债券投资者可能会那个决不能忽视的平均每小时工资较11月涨幅强烈反应呢。
·         The Fed believes there has been sufficient payroll growth to spur earnings gains, even if 2016 payroll growth itself disappoints versus 2015 standards.  The .2% growth expectation, then, easily becomes the important number to the Fed and the market almost regardless of overnight equities and bonds.  Yields will be more sensitive to a .3% result than .1%, selling off on the former and likely not rallying much at all on .1%.  FTN’s baseline looks for a 5-6bp move higher on 10-yr UST if earnings hit .3% -- provided yields are below 2.20% tomorrow morning.  We look for no change at .1% if all other figures fall roughly into line.  
Fed相信充分就业会刺激收入增加，即使2016增长逊于2015.0.2%增长目标（小时薪酬）就自然成为fed重要政策目标，市场也会到时无视隔夜股市和债市。收益率（t）可能对0.3%更加敏感，较其对于0.1%，即因前者会导致卖盘涌出而后者则有可能不会导致什么买盘。FTN的基础分析认为如果0.3%，10yr会涨5-6bps（如果明早收益率在2.2%以下的话）。我们预计如果其他数字正常的话，0.1%对债市没啥影响。
·         On the chance December shocks to the low side on earnings as it did last year  -- call it -.1% to 0.0% -- then expect a 4bp rally to the mid-teens on 10-yr UST.  Note, year-over-year earnings growth will look great on the charts due to the 1x dip last December.
考虑到去年出现的那种12月收入暴跌的情况——假设-0.1到0%--——预计10yr会涨4-15bps。需要指出的是，年化增长会依然很漂亮，因为去年12月的下跌。
·         With oil below $35/barrel despite a weaker dollar the last two days, we do not anticipate as much swing in 5-yr yields as in 10s.  3s and 5s are more sensitive to oil/China-related inflation expectations than 10s and 30s in the last six weeks.  A .3% or higher increase in hourly earnings should put 5s around 1.72%.
过去两天美元走弱，油价在35$以下，我们预计5yr不会像10s那样宽幅震荡。过去六周中，3s和5s对石油/中国相关通胀预期（大宗）更加敏感。小时工资0.3%或更高增长会导致5s跌到1.72%附近（北京时间16:00为1.63）
·         As for the headline totals, economists are squarely in the 200-210k range with a small skew that allows for 225k.  In other words (see chart), December is supposed to follow precisely along the path of November’s results.  FTN sees the potential for 15k-20k upward revisions to the previous month with little room for growth in October.  Odds of a net downward revision are about 25%.
 整体而言，经济学家预测值在200-210k，略微偏向225k。换句话说（看图），12月数字预计会精准地延续11月结果的路径（我也没搞懂什么意思，原文邮件删了）。FTN认为有可能对前月向上修正15-20k，使得10月（疑似12月）没啥上涨空间。净向下修正概率约为25%
Summary:
Most likely outcome: Payrolls at 185-225k, +15k revisions, unemployment 5.0%, and earnings at .2%   Market reaction: 5s between 1.64-1.70% and 10s stable between 2.17-2.225%. 
Bond bearish: Payrolls at 240+k, +30k revisions, unemployment at 4.9%, and earnings at .3+%.  Market reaction: 5s near 1.73%, 10s near 2.275%.
Bond bullish: Payrolls <=160k, -15k revisions, unemployment at 5.1%, earnings at .0%.  Market reaction: 5s at 1.61%, 10s at 2.16%.
        All yield ranges/outlooks are targeted at 90 minutes after the release of the report.
      
 
2.George Saravelos’s Special Report - It's baaack..! QT and some thoughts on China 
China's new currency policy signals the end of authorities' willingness to accommodate competitive devaluations from the rest of the world. The shift opens the door for bigger and more volatile moves in USD/CNY, and also signals that the effectiveness of future QE programs from the ECB, BoJ and beyond will markedly decline. Quantitative Tightening is "alive and kicking" because global reserve declines are accelerating from last year, helped by persistent China outflows and additional declines in the oil price. Until the market acquires greater confidence on the intended scale of currency depreciation as well as the equilibrium level of capital outflows (and effectiveness of capital controls) from China concerns around the new currency policy are unlikely to subside.中国最新货币政策表明中国官方对各国货币竞争性贬值的容忍已经到头了。政策转变导致更大更加剧烈的usd/cny价格变动大门拉开了，也预示未来ecb。Boj和其他国家的qe效果会大打折扣。“量化紧缩”已经到来了，因中国持续资本外流和油价加速下滑导致的全球外储下降正在加速。在市场对预计贬值规模和资本流出均衡（比如有效的资本管控）树立信心之前，围绕这一最新货币政策的焦虑都不会褪去。
 
3.us session color
 
—rbc
The market was much the same theme as the rest of this week, with the instability of Chinese markets leading to a further risk of rally of 2-5bps across the treasuries curve. There was again selling of 2y paper, but the levels have cheapened to draw in some foreign real money buying, and domestic buying on ASW. Also in line with the rest of this week, 2s5s continued to flatten, as 5s30s steepened to a recent high of 132bps. The belly led the richening today with more real money buying outright, as well as fast money buying 10s on the curve. The long end saw WN flattening back, real money two-way in bonds, buying of off the runs on ASW, and buying of long strips.
市场和全周差不多，中国股市不稳导致曲线全线涨2-5bps。2yr卖盘再次出现，但是卖点较低吸引了一些国内外真钱在asw（资产互换利率）水平买入。也和本周一样，2s5s持续走平，5s30s陡至近期高位132bps。中段因真钱买入存量券而领涨，快钱则买入10s。长端看到wn平回来了，真钱买卖都有，买过期券，买长端分离债。
 
Going into NFP tomorrow, it looks as if the employment data has been positive and we’ll expect an initially hawkish reaction (unless we see a huge miss).Since the curve’s come to a steeper level, there’s room to flatten however positioning continues to be in flatteners. We’d also expect 2s5s to steepen initially but also wouldn’t expect that to be maintained given the flows we expect.
 
明天就要迎来nfp了，看起来就业数据不错，我们预期最初会有鹰派的反应（除非大幅逊于预期）。因为曲线已经走得比较逗了，就有空间走平，尽管仓位一直在堵走平。我们也预计2s5s最初是会走陡，但考虑到走平仓位一直加仓，不保证其能持续。
-db
A very volatile session for treasuries on Thursday with the market finishing 4bps stronger led by the belly with Chinese stocks/CNY and oil continuing to drive price action.  Volumes were 138% of recent averages.
周四巨幅震荡，中段领涨，收高4bps，A股/cny/原油是交易诱因。交易量约为近期均值138%
Another weak CNY set (6.5646 vs 6.5314 ysdy) set about another wave of risk-off during the overnight session, with Chinese stocks going limit down (and closing for the day) after just ~14 mins of trading.  Treasuries capped higher on real money/central bank buying, and moved higher into London morning before running out of momentum against resistance in TYH6 at 127-10.  Fixed income reverted lower in NY morning, led by bunds (UST/bund close 5bps tighter) as heavy European sovereign supply proved somewhat difficult to absorb (including France's 10s, 15s & 30s, and Ireland's 10s).  Flows reversed to selling in early NY, with selling in 10s and 15s from international real money helping to pull treasuries from the highs.  
又一个走低的cny定盘价（6.5646 vs 6.5314）导致隔夜时段又一波去风险浪潮，伴随a股只交易了14分钟就熔断了。T走高，因为真钱和央妈们买入，一直涨到伦敦早盘，直至tyh6的127-10阻力位。固收在ny时段走低了点儿，由德国国债领跌（t和bund点差收紧5bps），因为欧洲各国政府债大量供给使得市场一时难以消化（包括发债10s15s30s和爱尔兰10s）。客盘在ny早些时段卖盘为主，国际真钱买盘集中在10s和15s拉低了t价格。
 
Headlines that China planned to suspend their 7% circuit breaker policy helped equities in early NY, however, this was subsequently reversed when a PBoC advisor called for a further 15% devaluation in CNY - both working to increase volatility in treasuries and stocks, and will no doubt put even further emphasis on Friday's CNY fixing.  From a flow perspective, the standout theme over the last several days of risk-off is the lack of real money demand at these yields - potentially helping to explain the slow pace of momentum in treasuries.
Ny早些时候，新闻头条是中国政府暂停熔断来维持股市，但是很快就因pboc顾问建议cny进一步贬值15%而逆转了——对t和股市震荡都起作用了，毫无疑问也加强了周五cny定盘价的重要性。从客盘观点看，过去几天的收益率不太有吸引力，这也有助于解释为什么t上涨动力来得这么慢（这还慢！）
 
NFP day, but this could be overshadowed if we get a weak CNY set today.  We're going in with 5/30s flatteners as a medium term trade.
NFP今天，但是要是cny定盘走低（高了一丢丢，央妈威武！）就被遮盖了，中期策略嘛，继续5/30s走平（rbc已经清仓了，db还远吗？浮亏严重啊）

2016-01-07 随手札记

20160107
 
昨天上午北朝鲜氢弹消息出来之后，t就涨啊，知道晚上非常好的ADP出来后回调了一下，但很快minutes的解读又是偏鸽派的，t就又跌了。
周五nfp大概率会比较好，预测比较保守（预测值与上期同），所以现在涨就涨吧。Ff概率为89.1%，周五晚上估计就回来了
To appease markets, the December numbers can't be too hot or too cold.
今晚spx1963很重要，纯技术分析。
 
 
1.SAFE按月公布外储，成为焦点
DB估计上月干预规模为400bn，清楚了解即期与远期同时操作，但远期不公布。
 
If the reserves data is better than expected, market is likely to assume the lack of intervention as another sign that the authorities are comfortable with a weaker CNY. On the other hand, a worse than expected number would make the market worry that ongoing FX outflows are getting worse and that the authorities are having a difficult time managing it. 
如以外储跌到3.42trn（干预减40bn，汇率减17.8bn）为界，多了说明pboc乐意看到cny走弱（利于出口，资金外逃成本也高点儿）；少了说明资本外逃更加严重，管理层任务很艰巨。
 
Either way, we do think market will take a higher or lower FX reserves as negative for CNY.——但不管怎样，都会压制cny
8月以来公布外储的时间如下
July - 10am
September - 3.50pm
October 10am
Nov - 12.12pm
Dec 4pm
Foreign Reserves (China) {CH}
OBSERVATION PERIOD: Dec (Monthly)
ACTUAL  : $3330.0b
PRIOR   : $3438.3b

资本外逃严重！干预规模125bn。具体计算还需看金融机构购汇数字调整。个人估计80bn
2.请教db经济学家的回复
AT1 refers to additional tier 1 capital instruments (for example preferred securities for US banks or CoCos (junior subordinated securities that can be written down or converted at discretion of regulator or upon falling below a stated capital level) for European banks.
CoCo supply refers to the amount of CoCo issuance we expect European banks to bring to market in 2016.
Hope that is helpful.
Best,
 
Brian
AT1为一级辅助资本，美资银行常用；cocos，附有赎回条款的次级债，二级资本，欧洲银行常用
 
 
3.昨夜minutes解读，预期的eagle tone未出现，业界倾向于gradual.fed注意力已经从劳动力市场转向通胀。
 
Five reasons for a gradual path. The minutes also point to a strong consensus regarding the expectation that any rate hike path would be gradual. The committee saw gradual hikes as keeping policy accommodative, which was important to support labor markets and inflation. Second, members felt that it would take time for inflation data to confirm the committee’s outlook. Third, a gradual path would allow time for the committee to assess the feedback between policy normalization and economic activity. Fourth, many estimates of r* – the real equilibrium policy rate – were low (near zero), which supports a gradual, cautious stance. Finally, the ability of monetary policy to respond to shocks in the neighborhood of the zero lower bound is viewed as asymmetric, meaning it is easier to raise rates in response to data outperformance than it is to provide further easing should the outlook worsen. This last point remains important, given the committee’s view that risks to growth and inflation remain tilted to the downside.
 
缓加息的5个理由。纪要还指出就市场预期任何加息都须徐步前进达成共识。委员会认为缓加息是保持政策灵活性，对呵护劳动力市场和通胀至关重要。其次，委员们认为需加以时日通胀数据才能确认委员会预期；三，缓加息使得委员会能够有时间评估政策常态化和经济活动之间的反馈；四，很多关于有效利率的估计——实际均衡的政策利率——都很低（接近0），这支持了缓加息作为谨慎步奏的选项；最后，货币政策对于那些0或更低利率邻居遭受冲击反应的能力是不对称的，即加息对待好消息易过进一步宽松应对坏消息。在委员会认为风险在集聚，通胀维持低位的情况下，最后一点依然重要。
 
4.
     The FOMC is currently comprised of five Washington-based governors and 12 regional Fed bank presidents. The governors and the president of the New York Fed hold permanent votes on policy decisions. The remaining 11 presidents share four votes that rotate on an annual basis.
Fomc由5位华盛顿地区的理事会成员和12个地区性联储银行行长构成。5位理事会成员和纽联储行长拥有永久投票权，剩余11位行长按年轮流有4票。
 
5.us session color
 
Treasuries continued to squeeze higher on Wednesday to close 8bps firmer led by intermediates as oil and risky assets remains under pressure.  Volumes were 136% of recent averages.
周三石油和风险资产继续受压，t中段领涨，收高8bps。交易量为近期均值136%
The ascent started during the overnight session, kicking off on the weak CNY fixing (6.5314 vs 6.5169 ysdy), and gaining more momentum as North Korea announced they'd tested an H-bomb.  TYH6 easily gapped through resistance at 126-18 and 126-24.  Risk assets slumped, however, Chinese stocks managed to buck the trend and closed stronger.  We witnessed buying from central banks and Asia real money in the long end, driving treasuries to bull flatten.  
上涨开始于半夜（美国时间），由cny定盘价走弱触发（6.5314vs6.5169昨天），北韩宣布氢弹试验后上涨动力持续。TYH6轻易涨穿126-18和126-24两道压力位。但是风险资产暴跌，虽然A股设法控制住了这个趋势，收盘有所上涨。我们看到央行和亚洲真钱在长端有所买入，促使曲线牛平（短端也涨，没有长端涨得多）
A solid ADP print at +257k briefly forced fixed income lower, however, ongoing weakness in oil/stocks kept the market supported - a spike in EIA inventory data (Gas inventory largest since '93) kept oil pinned.  Despite buoyant fixed income price action, our flows were all from the sell-side in NY hours with domestic and international real money selling throughout the day post ADP, with net selling summing to over $1.7bn 10yr equivalents (mostly in 10s & 30s).  The afternoon FOMC minutes were slightly more dovish than expected (some members referred to the Dec hike as a close call), allowing fixed income to grind higher into the close.  Corporate issuance was very light on Wednesday due to the risk-off environment.  
ADP读数+257k，仅压低了t一小会儿，持续走弱的石油和股市使得T得到支撑。尤其是EIA库存猛涨（汽油库存增量创93年以来新高）使得石油猛跌。不管T怎么涨势汹汹，公布ADP之后，我们的客盘在NY时段都是来自国内和国际的真钱账户抛售，净卖盘超1.7bn10yr等价物（大部分是10s和30s）。下午FOMC纪要公布后，解读较预期鸽派（有委员认为12月加息可加可不加），使得t再次上涨直到收盘。周三因风险反转氛围发行量很小。
 
We remain in 5/30s flatteners, but neutral duration.
我们继续维持5/30s走平观点，但久期中性。（long30s，空6倍5s，整体组合久期为0，但曲线走平获利。之前5/30可能是1:1空多，现在是短端加空，应该是认为短端涨得七七八八了）
 
6.LaVorgna: December Employment Preview
 
{http://pull.db-gmresearch.com/p/1361-883C/44860910/DB_DataFlash_2016-01-06_0900b8c08aa0cad2.pdf}
 
We are lowering our estimate of December nonfarm payroll growth because of the very soft (at least relative to expectations) December domestic automobile sales results. We are now at 160k, down from our earlier estimate of 200k.While we have casually observed that the financial markets tend to largely ignore the monthly motor vehicle sales reports, they are among our favorite real-time metrics of economic activity. (See “What do our five favorite indicators tell us about the economy?” US Economics Weekly, April 17, 2015.)
我们因12月机动车销售疲弱而降低12月nfp预测值。我们预计为160k，原来为200k。我们注意到金融市场倾向于忽视这个月度机动车销售报告，但是他们却是我们钟爱的经济活动实时度量指标。
Rounding out our top-five list of series that investors should be paying attention to are initial jobless claims, employee tax withholding receipts, the Fed’s Senior Loan Officer survey and the manufacturing ISM survey. We focus on these reports for a couple of reasons: One, they are highly correlated with economic activity, and two, perhaps more importantly, revisions to these series are minimal. In the case of the auto sales, tax receipt and Senior Loan Officer data, there are no revisions, while the revisions to claims and the ISM have historically been quite small, at least relative to the employment, GDP and retail sales revisions. The latter three series tend to attract an inordinate amount of attention, but as we have argued in previous work, the fact that these series are notoriously susceptible to large revisions can often complicate real-time economic analysis. Our five favorite indicators have no such problem.
我们最钟爱的也是投资者应该关注五个时序数据为：初请，雇员税预扣税（NFP的分项），联储高级信贷官调查和制造业ISM（4个？，还有一个联系上下文应是机动车销售）。我们关注这些原因在于：1、他们和经济活动高度相关，2、可能更重要的是，这些序列很少被修正。以机动车销售、雇员税预扣税和高级信贷官调查为例，压根就没有修正，ISM尽管有修正但都幅度很小，至少相对于雇佣类，GDP啦和零售数据的修正而言是比较小的。后面这三类数据总是能吸引过多注意力，但正如我们之前讨论的那样，这些时序数据以大幅修正而臭名昭著，使得经济实时分析难以进行。我们最钟爱的这五个序列则没有这个问题。
In December, domestic auto and light truck sales registered a 13.5 million SAAR. This compared to a consensus forecast of a 14.1 million SAAR. The resulting 0.6 million undershoot is large. In fact, it represents a one-standard deviation error. Since November 2003, which is when our data set begins, there have been 15 occasions when domestic vehicle sales have been at least one standard deviation below the consensus estimate. In 12 out of those 15 instances, nonfarm payrolls were below the consensus forecast, missing by 62k on average. If we add the three times when nonfarm payrolls surprised to the upside (the average was +43k), the overall average miss reduces to -41k. This is basically why we have decided to lower our estimate from 200k to 160k. But, our best guess is that in light of the better-than-expected ADP results, the consensus is actually anticipating a December nonfarm payroll number that is well above 200k. In this regard, our modest downward revision to December employment is noteworthy. As an important but unrelated aside, the Fed will not be troubled by a 160k gain in December payrolls because this is still fast enough in policymakers’ view to put further downward pressure on the unemployment rate and hence eventually push inflation higher.
12月，国内机动车和轻卡销售登记为13.5mi saar（us auto sales Total annualized）。相对于14.1mi的预期，少的这0.6mi可是个大数。事实上，这能有一个标差之多。200311月以来，也就是我们数据开始以来，共有15次最终结果位于预期值以下超过一个标差。这15次中的12个，nfp弱于预期，平均是少62k。如果我们把其余那三次nfp好于预期的加上，那就是15次中nfp平均少41k。这就是我们为什么从200k调低到160k的原因。但是，我们很有把握的猜测考虑到好于预期的ADP，市场的预期实际上已经超过了当前显现的200k。那么，我们向下温和修正就业数据就值得大书特书了。作为说一句重要但是无关的话，fed还是会觉得160k蛮好的，会推低失业率，继而最终推高通胀。
市场对好消息很脆弱。

8.来不及翻了，就是差不多前面说80bn的依据
 
 
PERRY KOJODJOJO :  - China Dec FX reserves was just released at $3.33trn, a dropped of $108bn from prior. This was much worse than market expectation and the lowest level since December 2012. After adjusting for FX valuation ($17.2bn), our model estimate possible intervention to be around $125.5bn. This would be the largest USD selling performed by the authorities on record. Do note in August when China had a one-off devaluation, USD selling was only around -$100bn. Given the sizeable drop in FX reserves, FX outflows could be around $156bn, also the largest on record. 
 
Why is the number much worse? We will need to wait for the overall net FX purchasing data by FIs to confirm whether China did see significant outflows. Now assuming outflows has again picked up notably, as mentioned in my comment yesterday, the much worse than expected FX reserves would likely result in the market assuming the authorities are not able to effectively control these flows and/or the authorities are not as concern about the outflows and the pace of weakness given ongoing comment that their focus is RMB vs the trade weighted basket. 
 
With the size of FX liabilities that still needs to be unwound is around $300bn according to our estimate (not including importers USD buying and domestic portfolio diversification), RMB depreciation will continue particularly if USD/CNY fixing continues to move higher than USD/CNY spot like today. Tomorrow USD/CNY fixing will be a focus. 
 
As mentioned in our report released this morning, we do think there is a risk we could see front loading of CNY weakness in the 1H of the year. Pls have a read at our report for more details and trading ideas -  http://pull.db-gmresearch.com/p/12695-0BEE/39237376/DB_SpecialReport_2016-01-07_GDPBD00000288295.pdf
 
9aisa session color
 
 
Market Commentary
 
Treasuries opened slightly lower than NYs 5pms before quick Japanese buying lifted the long-end. Another limit down day in China stocks, this time in less than 30mins from the open sent treasuries flying to the day’s highs. New buys, additional longs, stop-outs you name it. Nobody was looking to sell today. Oil dropped almost -4%, and the US overnight equities are indicating the DOW to open as low at -450pts (-2.5%).
开盘时较nys 5pms稍低，很快日本买盘拉起长端。A股再次熔断，这次不到30分钟导致t飞涨到日内高点。新买盘，多头加仓，止损，各种买。 没人看起来是卖的。原油跌4%，美隔夜股指推算dow跌450pts（-2.5%）
Japan’s Nikkei ended the session down -425pts to close (un)comfortably below Y18,000 as $/Y rocketed to Y117.70 when China plummeted. Just prior to the market open the MOF did release their Japan Buying of Foreign Bond data for the week ending last year. Japan were small net buyers, much of which we saw. But given it was the last week of 2015 and a short week with holidays, they didn’t buy as much as what they would have liked with yields around 2.30%. Japan has started this year off with good buying, although most of it MBS not UST. We expect next week’s MOF data to show that increased demand.
日经妥妥收跌425pts于18000下方，$/Y因A股暴跌的避险情绪涨至117.7。就在开始前，财务省发布了日本去年最后一周购买外国债券的数据。日本是小额净买家，我们已经看见很多了。但考虑到上周是2015最后一周，因假日而缩短的，他们买的可没有在2.3%水平时买得多。日本开年买得不少，尽管大部分买的是mbs，而不是ust。我们希望下周的财务省数据证明这一点。
Where to start with China? First the PBOC cut the reference rate 0.50%, the largest adjustment since the China crisis began in August last year. Then stocks opened for 29mins before circuit breakers kicked in for the second time this week, and the trading in the market was halted for the day. Expectations of further Yuan depreciation were cited as the reason behind the plunge. The offshore Yuan is now at its lowest levels against the greenback, with further downside expected. The PBOC announced a mid-day crisis meeting but then refused to discuss what measures were being considered leading to more concerns as to what tomorrow may bring. Late in the session China announced their foreign reserves dropped $110bn in December, as the country sells its foreign assets to pay for support at home. We expect that selling to continue, but as was the case all last year, with Japan buying don’t be surprised if yields do not go up. 
从哪儿说中国呢？最先是PBOC调降参考利率0.5%，去年8月以来的最大降幅，然后股市开盘29分钟就本周第二次熔断了，全天就停止交易了。暴跌的原因之一是预期人民币会进一步贬值，cnh现在可是对美元最低点，还要走低。Pboc宣布日中开了一次危机会议，拒绝透露下一步措施，使得市场更加焦虑明天会发生什么事儿。下午晚些时候中国外储公布，下降约110bn，都知道中国卖美债挺本币。我们预计这种抛售还会持续，就像去年全年一样，因为有日本买盘撑着，收益率不走高不足奇。 
 
Desk Views
 
We wrote to expect the world would come to an end this year. We just didn’t expect it this week. 10yr yields have rallied over 15bps since we kicked off 2016 and the appetite for safety of US bonds doesn’t seem ready to subside anytime soon. Is there value in 10yrs at 2.00%? Well if you look at the alternatives, the price action is saying yes. And the masters of trading low yielding environments, Japan, are saying yes too. For the moment. Still, the big-banks in Japan still think we’re within a range. So while they won’t sell USTs here, we think a few could pay swap. IRS is booked separate to cash, and if the global markets continue in this vein, then spreads are likely to widen making paying fixed a better choice than taking profits on cash they may need again later. 
我们原来写过这么折腾就到去年为止吧，真没想到这周会这样。2016开年，10yr就涨了15bp，趋向美债的避险需求还没有短时间消退吉祥。10yr值2.00%？好吧如果你瞅瞅替代品的话，价格上涨说值的！而且低收益率环境中交易宗师日本，也说值的！此次此刻，日本的大银行们还是认为我们还是在箱体震荡中呢。那么既然他们不会在这个价位抛售ust，我们就认为少数人会付互换（通过irs看涨利率）。Irs和国债现货分开簿记的，如果全球市场继续这么走下去，价差就会继续展宽使得付固定好于了结债券现货盈利，虽然晚些时候可能会需要这么做。（日本人都不会付固定，就不会有人付了。所以付的一方就会有溢价）
 
We also expect that Japan will continue to favour MBS over UST (as mentioned above). For now the majority of this buying is Lifers who prefer the carry of mortgages to the volatility of the UST long-end. Other investors types may have missed the boat this week, and so at some point we would think there has to be a slowing of purchases in the product from this region.  
我们还预计日本会喜欢mbs多过ust（如上述）。现在主要买家是首先公司，愿意拿着mbs 吃利息，而不是忍受ust长端的剧烈波动。其他投资者类型本周已经错过了这一波了，所以在某些点位我们预计会逐渐有本地区的买盘涌向这类产品。
 
So where to from here? We think the worst is still yet to come for Asia. As we wrote before, in order to turn domestic anger away from the central government, both Japan and China will start cranking up the nationalistic rhetoric as they did a couple of summers ago. Add a little North Korea to the mix, and Asia is going to continue to destabilize further. You read it here first! Additionally, we expect oil to keep going south with stocks, and the risk off sentiment to continue. Don’t forget this is still the first week of the year. It’s like a boxer getting knocked down right off the bell. He’ll be cautious in coming out strong the second time. The physiological damage to the New Year’s good intentions is already done.     
下一步怎么发展了。我们认为亚洲最糟糕的时候还没来呢。就像以前写的那样，为了将对中央政府的怒气转移出去，日本和中国将会像几年前那样鼓动民粹主义。小小北韩也来搅合，亚洲会更加不稳的。你读到了先！此外，我们预计石油会和股票一起向南(地图上南是下，cute boy)，风险厌恶情绪会持续。可别忘了这才是2016第一周。就像一个拳击手开钟就被击倒了。站起来就更加小心，也就有战斗力了。对新的一年好趋势的实质性心理伤害已经形成。
We also have growing concerns in the ME which will intensify as they get poorer on lower oil prices. The Fed Minutes were NOT hawkish, despite what some may want to believe. The Fed will be forced to choose their words and timing of future moves, and that is what is leading the front-end higher. 
 我们还担心中东紧张局势，尤其是那些国家因油价下跌更穷了。Fed纪要不那么鹰派，虽然有些人原因相信它很鹰派。Fed将被迫精选措辞，小心择机进一步行动，这使得前端上涨的原因。
As dark as we know our views are we fought this move too. We didn’t want to believe our inner self. So we’re stopped out to hold on to the PL we had before it all disappears and will respect this market for what it is telling us. Things are bad.   
我们知道我们的观点很黑暗，我们也是与之做斗争。我们也不相信内心的自己。所以我们在盈利消失之前清仓出局了，接受市场教训我们究竟是什么样子。世道不好啊~~（他们的5/30sflatters duration neutral的portfolio可能止损了）

——rbc
A rather choppy day today with external factors driving the price action. So far we haven’t seen the notable amount of buying in the long end, and saw better selling among two-way flow—hence some of the steepening today. Again there was selling in the front end  which contributed to the front end of the
curve flattening. 10s on the curve has richened essentially in a straight-line fashion since FOMC, and there’s been selling of 5s10s30s today in cash and paying in swaps; however we would still lean toward being long it here. Now that we’re past the year-end repo pressure, the implieds on the TY basis look
attractive and we’ve seen buying of the basis.
外部因素驱动的震荡的一天。截至目前，我们尚未看到长端明显买盘，买卖中卖盘多一些，导致曲线有所走陡。前端还是有卖盘，导致前段曲线走平，10s差不多就是FOMC会议时水平。5s10s30s都有卖盘，互换有人拿多头。但是我们还是倾向于在目前价位看涨的。现在我们已经度过了年底回购的压力阶段，意味着ty（国债期货）的基点看起来有吸引力了，而我们也已经看到买盘出现了。
——DB
 
Treasuries finished mixed on Tuesday with 5s closing 2bps strong while bonds cheapened a bp as equity volatility and corporate issuance pricing drove price action.  Volumes 114% of recent averages.
T周二涨跌互线，5s收涨2bps，公司债（不太肯定，指数？）跌1bp，股市波动和公司债巨量新发行是价格变动主要因素。交易量是近期均值的114%
 
Fixed income initially dipped in Tokyo as reports of intervention helped stabilize Chinese stocks (CSI 300 + 0.28%) and risk in general, however, swapped insurance in Europe and a relatively well received gilt auction buoyed bunds and allowed treasuries to push higher into NY open (UST/bunds widened by 2bps).  
有报道称干预稳定A股，东京时间开始FI跌了一下。但是很快，欧洲的互换保险和相对良好的英国国债拍卖支撑了德国国债，还使得T一直涨到ny开盘（T和德国国债点差展宽2bps）
 
Corporate issuance was the main theme in NY hours with ~$15bn in deals hitting the tapes on Tuesday, starting with the early rate locking in the long end of the Disney's $3bn multi tranche deal (pushing 5/30s 3bps steeper on the day).  USH6 underperformed on the curve, and we witnessed some unwinds of 5/30s flatteners from macro accounts - likely concerned about the heavy $115bn in corporate supply planned for January. The belly remained supported by the swapped pricing of EIB's $4.5bn 5s and KFW's $5bn 3s.  All up, a total of 10 deals priced on Tuesday.  Aside from flattener unwinds, flows were somewhat mixed.
Ny时段主角是公司债发信，周二总计15bn的规模，最先是Disney的3bn多层分级债，挂钩早些时候的长端（导致5/30s 日内走陡3bps）。Ush6走势弱于曲线，我们看到一些宏观账户（主要是hf）5/30s走平仓位的清盘。中段由于eib的5s 4.5bn和KEW的3s 5bn发行获得支撑。加总起来，周二新发行有10桩。除去走平仓位的清盘，客盘买卖均等的样子。
 
We remain in 5/30s flatteners, and believe tonight's FOMC minutes will be slightly more hawkish than expected. (Brad MacCulloch)
我们维持5/30s走平仓位，确信今晚fomc声明多少有点儿鹰派。
美国GDP统计是需求端统计，如果GDP增长过多依赖于去库存，那么实际厂商的生产会比较疲弱
J LaVorgna - Trimming our GDP estimates 05 January 2016 
 
{http://pull.db-gmresearch.com/p/2066-A825/29756012/DB_USEconDly_2016-01-05_0900b8c08a9f5e70.pdf}
 
We have reduced our estimate of Q4 real GDP growth by one full percentagepoint to 0.5%, and this still might be too high in light of what could bemuch larger inventory liquidation than what we have assumed. We discussthis in more detail below. The downward adjustment to Q4 2015 has theeffect of lowering our projected Q4-over-Q4 rate of real GDP growth by 30basis points (bps) to 1.7%. Someof the expected Q4 GDP softness may carry over into the current quarter.Therefore we have trimmed our current-quarter growth projection by 50 bpsto 1.5%. The 2016 forecast changes end here, as we are keeping ourestimates intact for Q2, Q3 and Q4 growth at 2.2%, 2.1% and 2.4%,respectively. If we are wrong, growth is likely to be weaker. Why are wemaking these changes? Data released over the last couple ofweeks (i.e., durable goods orders, advance international trade,construction spending and the manufacturing ISM) have been softer thanexpected. Most of this adjustment is due to less stockpiling. As we can seein the chart below, there is a high correlation between the change inprivate inventories and the inventory component of the manufacturing ISM—itis nearly 0.8. Lastquarter, ISM inventories fell to a reading of 44.3 from 48.8, the lowestlevel since Q4 2009, when inventory liquidation totaled nearly -$50billion. Thus, inventories could be lower than what we have predicted,possibly taking GDP temporarily into negative territory. Wehave decided to be a bit more conservative by assuming there is someresidual inventory liquidation to occur this quarter. If it turns out thatQ4 2015 stockpiles are even lower, then this could boost Q1 2016 real GDPat the margin. Still, the Q3 momentum of domestic demand appears to havestalled last quarter, and tighter financial conditions could weigh onspending this quarter. Hence, we believe it is prudent to make a modestdownward adjustment to our Q1 2016 GDP forecast. We hope our changes stophere. Whether they do will depend in large part on the price action in thefinancial markets. In particular, growth prospects for this year willdepend on whether the stock and credit markets can find footing and theappreciation of the dollar can abate. In the short term, the labor marketare likely to remain constructive, which means Fed commentary on the economy should continue to sound relatively upbeat as policymakers gear upfor another 25-bp rate hike this quarter. Stay tuned. 
我们已经调降Q4GDP增长0.5个百分点（0129公布），考虑到去库存压力比我们假设的大很多，这个预测还是太高。下面我们详细说说。2015Q4 gdp向下调整对我们的QoQ年化增长率有30bps影响，至1.7%。Q4 GDP增长乏力可能影响到现在这个季度。那么我们就调降了本季预计值50bp到1.5%。2016的预计就是这样了，其他各季不变，分别为2.2%，2.1%和2.4%。我们要是错了，增长可能会更弱一些。为什么呢？前几周公布的数据（耐用品订单，初步贸易数据，建筑业开销以及制造业ism）都比预期要疲软。调整主要缘由库存减少。正如下图所见，私营部门的库存变化和制造业ism之间有着高达0.8的线性关系。上个季度（其实是Q3），ISM库存读数从48.8跌到44.3，为2009Q4以来最低，存货清减将近50bn。这样，存货水平（Q4）可能更低，会拖累GDP负增长。我们决定还是保守一点，假设有一部分是由于本季存量住房清仓。如果到时候2015Q4的库存水平更低的话，则有可能推动2016Q1GDP边际增长。而且，Q3的国内需求动能似乎在Q4停滞了，紧缩的金融状况可能会压缩Q4的消费。那么，我们认为调降2016Q1的预测值是合力的。我们希望调整就到此为止吧。是否这些调整取决于金融市场的价格变动（呢？）尤其是，今年的增长预期依赖证券和信贷市场能否站得住，美元升值则会阻碍增长。短期来看，劳动力市场还是很有建设性的，这将会使fed关于经济的评论还是正面的，以便为再次25bp的加息做准备。别走开，马上回来~~~

昨晚睡前看了一下市场，t涨，金涨，银涨，油涨，股跌，太成功了，心满意足睡觉了。可是早上一看，统统大幅回调，虽然方向没错，但是盈利幅度缩水严重啊。What’s going on!
Stronger manu PMIs in Germany (53.2 vs 53 expected) and the EZ (53.2 vs 53.1)
今晚机动车销售数据
尾端风险，嗯嗯--4
大概是因为市场定价不充分，近期t还是以跌为主，所以有市场对好消息很脆弱的说法

Fed Fischer (dove, voter) 
Mester (hawk, voter) 
 
 
Treasuries rallied on Monday to start to year, closing 3.5bps stronger led by the belly as a rout in Chinese stocks triggered a broader risk-off.  Volumes were in-line with recent averages.
T周一上涨开年，中段领涨，收高3.5bps，缘起中国股市暴跌导致大面积风险厌恶情绪。交易量与近期均值一致。
The ascent higher started shortly after the Tokyo open as Chinese mfg PMI missed at 48.2, CNY broke 6.50 (lowest print since 2011), and Chinese stocks aggressively gapped lower - CSI 300 tripped through two circuit breakers before being halted for the day at -7.0%.  The uptrade in fixed income continued into London hours as the risk-off spread to European stocks (Euro Stoxx -3.14%).  We witnessed buying from central banks and fast money in 2s and 5s as the risk-off gathered momentum.  Weak data during the NY morning (both construction spending and ISM mfg missed estimates) added fuel to the fixed income rally, with USH6 driving the early NY session rally.  
Ty开始不久中国制造业PMI逊于预期的48.2公布后上涨就开始了，cny破6.5（2011以来最低），A股跌得很凶，csi300触发两次熔断，直至-7%。固收买盘一直持续到伦敦开始，风险厌恶氛围衍生到了欧洲股市（EURO STOXX -3.14%）。风险厌恶情绪蔓延的时候，我们看到有央行和快钱买入2s和3s。Ny时段疲弱的数据（建筑业开销和ism制造业指数）又火上添油，ush6（ust期货）在ny时段早些时候领涨。
 
We ran into more fast money and bank buying in 5s during the NY morning, and macro initiation of 3s/10s flatteners.  Our net buying on the day summed to over $1.1bn 10yr equivalents.  Treasuries ran out of steam just after NY lunch as stocks stabilized and the street started to focus on the heavy corporate issuance pipeline this week/month (expected to be over $115bn in January, which is ~$25bn larger than January in 2015 and 2014).  
Ny上午时候，还有更多的快钱和银行买入5s，总体上3s/10s走平。我台净买入估计超1.1bn的10yr等价品（将各期限国债折算为10yr久期）。Ny中饭后t就滞涨了（实际回调不少），市场关注点转移到了本周/月巨量公司债供应上来了（预期超115bn新发行，比2015和2014的一月大概大25bn）。
 
We remain in 5/30s flatteners.  Targeting a move to 115bps.
我们维持5/30s走平观点，目标位115bps（北京时间周二下午3点为125bps）
 
 
Bottom Line - Our baseline forecasts:
 
-> GDP growth in 2016 remains 6.7%.
2016GDP增长维持在6.7%
-> USDCNY to 7.0 by the end of 2016.
2016年底，usd/cny涨到7
-> And two cuts of benchmark interest rates
两次降息
Investors and policy makers increasingly focus on the tail risks in China. But the conventional practice in the market is to forecast macro data under the most likely scenario only (the baseline). It does not quantify the tail risks explicitly.
投资者和政策制定者越来越关注中国的尾端风险。传统的做法仅仅是在最可能的场景下预测宏观数据，这可不太能完全搞定尾端风险。！！！！！！
 
In this note we lay out our forecasts on the “indicative” probabilities of all possible scenarios for GDP growth, exchange rate, interest rate, and inflation.The baseline forecasts are included as a special scenario.
Our baseline forecast for GDP growth in 2016 remains 6.7%. We see 10% probability that GDP growth may be above 7% in 2016, 50% probability that it falls between 7% and 6.5%, 30% probability that it drops to the range of 6.4% and 6%, and 10% probability it falls below 6%. We see 20% probability the GDP
growth to fall below 6% for four consecutive quarters sometime between 2017 and 2019.
本文我们罗列出所有GDP增长、汇率、利率和通胀的可能场景的指示性概率。最基础的预测作为一个特定场景包括在内。我们的基础预测是2016GDP增长维持在6.7%。我们认为有10%可能超7%，50%可能在6.5%和7%之间，30%可能在6.4%和6%之间，10%可能低于6%。我们认为2017到2019年之间某四个连续季度的gdp增长有20%可能低于6%。
 
We revise our baseline forecast for USDCNY market close rate to 7.0 by the end of 2016, a depreciation of 7.9% from its market close of 6.49 on December 31 2015. We see 10% probability that CNY appreciates or stay flat against USD by the end of 2016, 20% probability that it depreciates by less than 5%, 50%
probability it depreciates by more than 5% and less than 10%, 20% probability that it depreciates more than 10%. We expect two cuts of benchmark interest rates as our baseline case. We see 5% chance that there is no interest rate cut, 20% chance that there is one interest rate cut, 50% chance that there are two rate cuts, 15% chance there are three cuts, and 10% chance there are four or more cuts.
我们将对usdcny的基础预测修正为2016年底接近7.0，从20151231的6.49位置大概贬值7.9%。我们认为2016年底10%可能是人民币升值或不动，20%可能是贬值幅度小于5%，50%可能是贬值幅度超5%但小于10%，20%可能是贬值超10%。我们在基础性预测中估计两次减息。5%可能是不见兮，20%可能是一次减息，50%可能是2次减息，15%可能是3次减息，10%是四次或更多次减息。
 
We also provide probability forecasts on CPI inflation. We emphasize these are “indicative” probabilities which to a large extent reflect our judgments. We discuss the key macro messages behind the probability forecasts in this report.
我们还有关于cpi概率的预测。我们强调这些都是指示性的，反应的是我们的判断。我们在下面报告中用预测概率来讨论宏观信息。
{http://pull.db-gmresearch.com/p/5437-02F2/46067255/
DB_SpecialReport_2016-01-04_GDPBD00000288142.pdf}
 
 1) Dec Caixin manufacturing PMI deteriorated to 48.2 from prior 48.6, despite an edge-up in NBS manufacturing PMI to 49.7 from prior 49.6; 2) RMB depreciated sharply today with CNH dipping beyond 6.62 and CNY falling over 6.53; 3) mounting investor concerns on A-share supply increase as the selling restriction on major shareholders (>5% holding) is due to expire on 7 Jan and more IPO may be launched soon; and, perhaps more importantly, 4) the newly enacted circuit breaker may have exacerbated market concerns on liquidity dry-up and pushed A-shares to the stop line of -7% for CSI300.
 
For instance, in the US, market trading will be suspended for 15 minutes if S&P500 changes reach 7% and 13%, and completely stop if ±20%; similarly, in South Korea, trading will be suspended for 20 minutes if KOSPI/KOSDAQ hits 8% and 15% and fully stop if ±20%. This is particularly true given the higher realized market volatility in the A-share market than global peers (Figure 3).
 
美国是spx变化达到7%和13%时，停牌15分钟，正负20%时就彻底停盘；韩国，KOSPI/KOSDAQ变化达到8%停盘20min，正负20%时就彻底停盘
 
 
 
Aggregate net speculative positions in Eurodollar and Treasury futures increased by $3.9 billion to -$51.4 billion in ten-year cash equivalents.——少一个数
美债期货净投资头寸增3.9bn到-51.4bn
Speculators turned net long in TY futures by 43K contracts, as they bought over 55K contracts. Specs also decreased their net shorts in FV and TU futures by 16K and 13K contracts, respectively. 
投资头寸在ty（10年期美国国债期货）反多，增43k合约，买入了超过55k张。投资头寸分别在fv和tu上减仓口头头寸16k和13k。（迎接本周工业数据及就业不那么强劲？也可能是欧洲会有坏消息，导致资金回流美国，欧元走低，t涨，whatever）
However, specs increased their net shorts in Eurodollar futures by 98K contracts to a new high of 412K contracts since December 
但是，投资头寸增加了eurodollar净空头98k张合约，达到12月以来的新高至412k张。
{http://pull.db-gmresearch.com/p/1909-FAC7/31349410/DB_ComTradersWkly_2016-01-04_0900b8c08a9e93f3.pdf}
 
一是ism的子部分就业数据疲软构成本期读数逊于预期的主要原因，二是历史上看ism对于经济的先行作用更加明显。
Download the complete report: http://pull.db-gmresearch.com/p/2065-3E72/29016098/DB_USEconDly_2016-01-04_0900b8c08a9e3d8b.pdf 
Commentary for Tuesday: For the first time since the end of the last recession, the manufacturing ISM survey registered its second consecutive sub-50 reading in December (48.2 vs. 48.6 previously). These data confirm that the factory sector is contracting, a function of a strong dollar, mildly excessive inventory building and weakening overseas demand. For what it is worth, the weakness in the December ISM was concentrated in the employment subcomponent (48.1 vs. 51.3), which raises the risk of a weaker-than-expected reading on December nonfarm payrolls this Friday. We are projecting a 200k increase in payrolls and a steady 5.0% reading on the unemployment rate. These forecasts are in line with consensus expectations. We will revisit our forecasts following the results of Wednesday's ADP private employment report for December. The weak manufacturing ISM results do not bode well for the non-manufacturing ISM. As we wrote last month, there is a relatively large gap between the two surveys, with the reading on the latter substantially above that on the former—the gap was nine points in October and has since fallen to seven points as of November. The December non-manufacturing ISM survey is released after the aforementioned ADP data.
There has been a substantial spread between the two ISM surveys on only two previous occasions. One time was from December 2000 to February 2001 and the other time was August 2005. In each instance, the divergence between the series was closed because the non-manufacturing ISM ultimately followed the downtrend already in place in the manufacturing ISM. The two series are shown in the chart below. The early 2000s period bears the most similarity with the current environment in the sense that the manufacturing ISM was under 50. Specifically, the December 2000 manufacturing ISM was 43.9, while the non-manufacturing ISM was 54.0. This resulted in a record 10-point spread between the two series. This divergence was reconciled by August 2001, when the gap closed to less than one point because the non-manufacturing survey eventually collapsed. In August 2005, when recession was still a couple of years away, there was nearly a nine-point gap between the two series. This spread closed in the following month, as the non-manufacturing ISM fell and the manufacturing ISM rose. However, the increase in the latter was short lived, as the series continued to trend lower, with the non-manufacturing ISM survey eventually following suit. Even though the manufacturing sector accounts for only about 10% of the overall economy, it is highly cyclical and is a leading indicator of broader economic trends. Consequently, the manufacturing ISM survey remains a useful forecasting tool for predicting trends in underlying GDP growth.

Article No. 289
20160104
2016-01-04 随手札记

隔夜芝加哥pmi和初请都出幺蛾子了，ct3涨4bps啊！A股熔断再熔断，晚上t还得涨啊！
 
1.
 
Fed Fischer (dove, voter) said rate hikes may be needed if markets overheat;
Mester (hawk, voter) said recent data shows inflation moving higher
 
 
 
2.一周前瞻
 
The New Year begins with a jam-packed data docket. On Monday morning we get the December manufacturing ISM and November construction spending. The former should remain in contraction territory as the manufacturing sector faces three important headwinds, namely, dollar strength, weak energy-related capital spending and inventory liquidation. The manufacturing ISM is highly correlated
with real GDP growth even though the manufacturing sector accounts for only 12% of total economic output. By contrast, construction spending will likely increase for the 12th consecutive month, led by the private residential sector. We expect residential construction to grow by nearly 10% in 2016, making
housing one of the bright spots in our otherwise cautious outlook.
新年伊始数据频仍。周一早上12月制造业ISM PMI（也有markit pmo）和11月建筑业支出。前者应还在萎缩区间，因为制造业三大难题，分别是：强势美元、低能源价格导致的资本支出削减和去库存化。制造业ISM与GDP增长高度相关，虽然它只是构成整个经济产出的12%。相反，建筑业支出有可能连续12个月保持正增长，私人住宅建筑支出一马当先。我们预计2016年住宅建筑可能增长将近10%，在我们2016其实算相当谨慎预测中的闪光点了。
 
December motor vehicle sales (17.90M forecast vs. 18.06M previously) will be reported throughout the day on Tuesday. We expect this series, one of our five favorite economic indicators, to stay near its cyclical high (18.12M), indicating that consumer spending remains firm due to the strength of the labor
market. This strength should be reflected in Wednesday's ADP employment report (+200k vs. +217k) for December, which will likely signal a robust employmentreport on Friday.
12月机动车销售（预测17.9m，前指18.06m）将于周二日内公布。这是我们最喜欢的5个经济指标之一，我们预测其将维持景气周期高位（18.12m），表明因劳动力市场繁荣导致的消费者支出维持强劲势头。这个繁荣态势还将反映在周三的12月份的ADP就业报告中（+200k vs +217k），它也可能意味着周五就业报告强劲。
 
However, the weakness in manufacturing could affect some of Wednesday's other data releases. The November international trade balance (-$44.0B vs. -$43.9B), November factory orders (Unch. vs. +1.5%) and the December nonmanufacturing ISM (56.0 vs. 55.9) will likely be little changed from their previous levels. The last series has moderated from its cyclical high, possibly indicating spillover of the manufacturing slowdown into the services sector.
但是呢，制造业的疲弱可能会影响到周三公布的其他数据。11月国际贸易收支（-44.0bn vs -43.9bn），11月工厂订单（不变 vs +1.5%）以及12月的非制造业ISM（56.0 vs 55.9）都可能较上期变化很小。非制造业ISM可能从景气高点温和下滑，有可能意味着制造业放缓的外溢效应影响到了服务业。
 
On Wednesday afternoon we also get the minutes of the December FOMC meeting,when the Fed raised rates for the first time in nearly a decade. The minutes are expected to be consistent with the balanced tone of the statement. We will be particularly interested in the counterarguments that were posed to liftoff,as these will be indicative of potential headwinds to further rate increases in 2016. While the Fed's median forecast is that there will be four 25-bp rate hikes next year, the market is only expecting two hikes. Investors should also look for details on the Fed's SOMA reinvestment policy.
 
周三下午，还有12月FOMC会议纪要，就是那个决定了近10年来首次加息的会议。这个纪要预计将吻合委员会声明的平衡式口吻。我们对于其中反对加息的争论部分很感兴趣，那将是对2016加息潜在困扰的兆示。在预期中位数为2016年内fed将有四次26bp加息条件下，市场却只定价了两次。投资者还应关注fed的soma（system open market acount，因公开市场操作所获金融资产账户An account that is managed by the Federal Reserve Bank, containing assets acquired through operations in the open market. The assets in the System Open Market Account (SOMA) serve as a management tool for the Federal Reserve's assets, a store of liquidity to be used in an emergency event where the need for liquidity arises, and as collateral for the liabilities on the Federal Reserve's balance sheet such as ）的再投资政策。
The highlight of the week is Friday's employment report. We expect steady growth in nonfarm payrolls (+200k vs. +211k) and private payrolls (+200k vs. +197k). The unemployment rate (4.9% vs. 5.0%) is likely to fall by a tenth, reaching the FOMC's median estimate of the natural rate of unemployment. Since
the Fed is close to meeting its unemployment mandate, the wage inflation data will assume particular importance. Average hourly earnings (+0.2% vs. +0.2%) should increase by two tenths, causing the year-over-year rate to rise from 2.3% to 2.8%, close to the 3% level that the Fed believes is consistent with
its 2% price inflation target. However, we caution against reading too much into a spike in year-over-year wage growth, because of anomalous base effects.Earnings decreased by two tenths in December 2014, but then increased by six tenths the following month. Therefore, the year-over-year growth rate is likely
to fall back below 2.5% in the January 2016 employment report, indicating that wages are yet to accelerate meaningfully. The last data releases of the week are November wholesale inventories (Unch. vs. -0.1%) and consumer credit (+$14.0B vs. +$16.0B). 
本周热点当然是周五nfp。我们预期nfp(+200k vs. +211k) 和nfp pch(+200k vs. +197k)稳定增长。失业率(4.9% vs. 5.0%) 有可能跌十分之一，达到fomc关于自然失业率估计的中位数。Fed即将达到失业率强制目标了，工资通胀数据就会越来越重要了。平均每小时工资 (+0.2% vs. +0.2%)将增十分之二，导致年化增长率从2.3%增至2.8%，接近fed认为与2%通胀相匹配的3%年化增长目标。但是因为非常态的基数影响，我们必须小心指出年化增长加速意义不大。2014的12月收入降低0.2%下个月又增长了0.6%。类似的，2016年1月的就业报告中的年化增长有可能降至2.5%，表明工资收入尚未加速上涨。本周最后公布的数据是11月批发库存(Unch. vs. -0.1%) 和消费者信贷 （+$14.0B vs. +$16.0B).
 
3.美国时间日评（2015最后一天，北京时间周四晚间）
 
Treasuries rallied on Thursday to close 4bps stronger led by the belly as month end extension buying (0.10yr UST extension) combined with weak stocks and soft data. Given the early close, broker volumes were light at just 59% of recent averages.T周四上涨，收盘升4bps，受月末延展购买影响，中段领涨，复合弱股市和弱数据。因提早收盘，经纪数量很少，大概常量59%。With treasuries closed in Tokyo for a bank holiday, overnight trading was quiet. Fixed income started to move higher just ahead of the NY open as the street started to set up for the afternoon index extension and stocks came under some pressure. Once trading opened in NY, we quickly witnessed a wave of domestic real money buying across the curve, which continued into the close and summed to over $2.5bn 10yr equivalents. A jump in jobless claims to 287k and a slump in Chicago PMI to 42.9 (lowest in 6 years) also buoyed fixed income. A mid-day jump in oil briefly pulled treasuries lower, but this proved short lived as more index buying emerged to take us out at the highs of the day at the early 1pm close. 日元假日，隔夜交易很轻。固收在ny盘前即走高，正值街上在为下午指数延展定调和股市受压的情况下。Ny一开始，我们就看到一波国内真钱全曲线买入，持续到收盘，总值约当2.5bn10yr。初请跳升到287k和芝加哥PMI跌到42.9（6年来最低点）也推高了固收。日内油价跳涨压制了t一下，但很快就更多的指数延展买盘在1pm收盘前于日内高点买空了我们。We remain in 5/30s flatteners, targeting a move to 115bps.
我们维持5/30s走平观点，目标位115bps（北京时间14:17，ct51.723，ct30 2.991，spread  126.8bps）
 
4.亚洲时间日评
 
 
Market Commentary
 
Happy New Year. Treasuries opened lower than NYs 2015 closes but that was very short lived. Stocks in Asia cracked from the open and this brought in buying in treasuries across the region across the curve. Volumes were actually quite low given the range indicating just how bad liquidity is on day one. While we expect liquidity to improve as all major center’s record a full day’s trading, it may be a sign of things to come if clients all try and go the same way at once this year. 30yrs had a full point range on a mere 300mm, with SPs down -1.50% to begin the year. 
$/Y rallied to Y119.00 sending the Nikkei lower (-600pts), as the FTQ attributes of the Yen in the new year stood out, and China stocks crumbled. JGBs rallied, but given their already low yields, not as much as USTs, which saw good Japanese buying. We think this trend has to continue as JGB yields are not going higher this year. More on that below. For equities, it is the worst opening day for Japan since the world started to fall apart in 2008. 
新年好。T比ny收盘低开，很快拉起。亚洲股市开盘暴跌导致t买盘蜂拥而入。考虑到新年第一天低流动性导致的振幅（很宽），交易量实际上算低的。我们预计所有主要市场经历过一个完整交易日后，如果客户都是这么冲进来的话，才有可能是预兆什么的。30yr有个大数的波幅，成交量才300mm，而SPs跌1.5%迎来新的一年。$/y涨至119，导致日经暴跌（-600pts），避险交易不再垂青日元，中国股市暴跌。JGBs上涨，考虑到他们已经很低的收益率，对买盘的吸引没有ust大。我们认为这个趋势今年将持续，JGB的收益率也不会上扬。在那之前，买盘还会更多。股市可是08以来日经开盘最糟糕的开年第一天。
If you bought Chinese shares on the open you have now blown away -7% of your money already, as that is what the Shanghai Index was forced to close at when circuit breakers kicked in. Today was the first test of China’s new rules to halt trading after intra-day percentage declines. At least we know the system works! No doubt the PBOC will have more work to do, especially before the Chinese New Year holidays next month. Today marked the worst opening day ever for China shares, which brought all of Asia tumbling with them. The PBOC did intervene in their currency late in Asia time (start of London), so their concern is obvious. 
如果开盘买入A股，现在可能损失7%了。所以上海股市启动熔断机制了。今天是A股新规第一天。至少我们知道了这个机制管用的！毫无疑问pboc又该忙了，尤其是在春节前。今天是A股最糟糕的一天，引发亚洲股市集体暴跌。PBOC在亚洲晚些时间干越汇市，也是明显体现出他们的焦虑。
Needless to say bunds gapped higher on their open to catch up to the overnight treasury market, opening up 90c and pushing European yields lower. German CPI data today but it’s safe to say that stocks will dominate the picture globally today. The DAX is down -3% and FTSE down -2% as we write.  
德国国债跳涨，紧随ust。高开90c，推低欧洲收益率。德国今天CPI数据，但敢说股市今天是主旋律。这会儿Dax跌3%，ftse跌-2%。
 
Desk Views
 
So our predictions for 2016 are already coming true! For those who missed our gloomy forecasts late last year we will print them again, afresh for you. 
我们关于2016的预测实现了。！谁错过了我们会再印给你！刷新一下吧！
2015 was the worst year since 1937 for asset allocations and we think this year will be even bad..der. Already stocks are down big and sentiment is not behind them to see any long term corrections just yet. Central Banks don’t have a remedy. Treasuries have rallied today, yes, but they’re not going to simply benefit one-for-one with stocks. Remember the Fed should hike further this year, and that will ultimately be bad for bonds. 
就资产配置而言，2015年是1937年以来最糟糕的一年，而且我们觉得今年可能会更糟。股市已经跌下去很多，掩藏不住的风险偏好显然还看不到任何长期的纠正（没有跌透？）。央行也没有良策。T今天已经涨了，但对股市没用。要知道fed今年会进一步加息，最终对债市构成重压。
 
China weakening further will mean the Yen picks up FTQ status as it did during the global crisis. This is bad for Japan stocks, which is in turn even worse for China and Asia stocks. But since it will be a fundamental shift again, there’s not a lot Abe can do about it. And he’s already unpopular in Japan. As the Japanese economy weakens more it could see his grip on power fade, and there is nobody to fill his shoes. Expect the BOJ and Abe to throw everything at the Yen before that, but that just ignites a currency war with China which already looks under way. Economic tensions could lead to military skirmishes too, as both countries try flex their muscles on contested boarders and try to divert any domestic attention away from failed policies. 
中国经济走弱，Yen就会被作为避险天堂，就像前次全球金融危机那样。这对日本股市不是好事，反而对中国和亚洲股市构成负反馈。但这再次成为一个基本面的的切换（隐含看法中国经济长期走弱），Abe将对此无能为力。而却Abe在日本也不那么受欢迎了。日本经济走弱的话，影响力会减弱，但没有人能填补空白。除非BOJ和Abe在那发生之前全力施压日元，可那会显然导致货币战争（FUCK！日元贬值一半，瞎啊！），而看起来中国已经在开战了。经济压力还会导致军事上擦枪走火，尤其是两国都在展示肌肉，试图转移国内注意力。
 
The Middle-East doesn’t look like they’ll reach a peace accord anytime soon, and the latest between Iran and Saudi could spiral out of control. If oil continues to drop that weakens the Saudi’s ability to impress upon the region it’s views, and right now oil doesn’t look like having a huge retracement. Iran could still see sanctions come back quick, and that lack of economic hope for any nation in the region will only mean more violence amongst them. 
中东看起来短时间内不可能达成和平协议。伊朗核沙特的冲突可能导致升级。如果油价持续下跌，就会削弱沙特施压该地区自身观点的能力，而现在油价看起来不像已经暴跌的样子（还有下跌空间？）伊朗可能会发现禁运很快又来了。该地区任何国家经济无望只会导致国家之间的暴力冲突。
 
Europe will likely continue to be at odds with itself over immigration. And without a strong economy to pay for new arrivals, we would expect many countries keep taking a few more steps to the right. The UK has to decide whether they want to be a bigger or smaller part of Europe too this year. A “no thank you” vote could further disrupt hopes of a more united continent.
欧洲可能还在盘算自己的移民政策。没有强劲的经济基础偿付新移民的话，我们预计会有很多国家逐渐向右走。Uk就要是否脱欧公投了。脱欧赞成票可能会进一步摧毁一个更加团结大陆的希望。
 
Then we have the US itself. A Presidential election which will be about choosing the least worst candidate. We’re still hoping for Bush, but right now it looks like Trump vs. Hillary. Neither one of them good for the country, or the world, at a time when the world needs US leadership more than ever.  
现在说说美国。总统大选可能要选出一个最糟糕的候选人了，我们期冀bush，虽然现在看起来Trump和Hillary更有可能。他们任何一个对国家和世界都没哈好处，尤其是在世界急需美国领导力的当下（吹牛吧！）。
 
We’ve only begun to scratch the surface of what will be bad about this year and its only day 4. We took a survey of Japanese clients today, and while their views differ slightly, one thing they all say in unison is that volatility will be high, and “trustable trends” low. This means liquidity will only come at a premium, and that restricts trading. That means buy and hold for our clients, and an increase focus on simple carry trades. In order for carry to be valuable though, we would need higher yields from here. We do know Japan will continue buying above 2.30%. We do not think Japan will look to take profits soon however, not while equities are so volatile. They could pay swap as they did throughout December to hedge their portfolio risk, but that would be the extent of it.
我们已经开始揭晓什么队今年是坏事了，虽然只是第4日。今天我们调查了日本客户，他们观点稍有不同，有个共识是波动率会很高，且“可信任（跟随？）波段”少。这就会导致流动性只会用溢价方式体现，这就限制了交易。那就意味着买入和为客户持仓，不断增长的简单乘息交易的注意力。我们很清楚日本会持续在2.30%以上买入。但是我们不认为日本会很宽止盈，至少在股市如此脆弱的时候。他们能够像12月时候套保组合风险那样作为swap的付方（利率多头），但这仅是引申了（总之就是日本客户对于2.3以上胃口大大的，只买入不卖出）。
 
So there you have it. Our cheery look in to the world of 2016. We think it will be another tough environment to trade, with emphasis on going with the flow. Mark-to-marketing of more optimistic views will be tough and expensive.  
这就是我们对2016的观点。我们认为交易环境还会是比较困难的，如果重心在于更随客盘的话。盯市的任何比较乐观的观点都难以置信和昂贵（付出代价？）

Article No. 290
1231 外一篇
2015-12-31 随手札记

1231
 
 
 
 
1.昨晚待定房屋销售确实惊人了，但是负面的。最近半年以来，房屋和消费可一直是美国经济的亮点啊！捎带着之后的存屋销售数据也好不了。21:30数据一出，ct3涨近2bps，短暂回调后再涨1bp。Ct10涨跌涨，最后收高1bp，欧美时间曲线算是走陡了。FF推算的12/14/2016的加息概率为93.8%，昨天为94.2%（看来pending house的意外不够分量）。今天日本假日，全天市场都会如死水一样平静。GDP可以超过他，国际清算占比可以和他差不多，国际金融市场影响力还是有点差距的。
黄金跌有点儿看不懂，也许是santa rally结束了就这样。个人感觉白银跌到位了才有抄底可能。等等看吧
今晚的初请有意思了
节后的工业数据估计都好不了，好像有long的机会了~~
2.缩略，花旗关于大宗的2016展望——觉得不怎么样
COMMODITY
* Commodities 2016 Annual Outlook - Down but not out - on the road to modest recovery
https://ir.citi.com/0TUMqM1MEJ9%2frg2Rwfhug6Ixt2Ar5Jzs1AOVmfReU0vxeewWN%2bSmz4s2AQrhw%2fBQ079m0V4ygUc%3d
 
- 2016 to be year of volatile and ongoing “W-shaped” price adjustments due to uncertainty of supply and demand shifting to balance for commodities 
2016年将是震荡的一年，因供求平衡的不确定性可能导致“W型”价格调整。
- More persistent price recovery for oil, base metals and agriculture by 2017
2017年之前，油、基本金属和农业更加持久的价格复苏
- Rising USD will pose a strong headwind for commodities, though impacts will vary from strong impact for commodities such as gold to virtually no impact for commodities like soybeans 
强势美元持续困扰大宗，尽管效果千差万别，如强烈压制金价而对大豆类商品没啥影响
- Producer currency depreciation against USD and underlying cost deflation keeps pushing cost curves down 
制造国货币对美元贬值和生产成本通缩持续推低成本曲线。
- Citi’s outlook for end 2016 projects higher prices for US natural gas, crude oil, all base metals
花旗预测2016年底美国的天然气、原油和所有基本金属价格会高一些。
- Headwinds remain: persistent oversupply, expected continued USD appreciation, further China weakness and negative sentiment towards commodities 
负面因素包括：持续供应过剩，预期美元持续升值，中国经济继续走弱和对大宗的负敏感性
- Citi view: futures markets pricing below fair market value. Citi sees many markets beginning to tighten in the latter half of next year as the impact of lower prices fully filters through on the production side.Growth in the developed world remains tepid and Citi expects sub-3% global GDP growth to persist into 2016. Outside the US, the developing world has struggled to revive stagnant economies post-2008. Citi sees ~2% growth through 2017 for industrial economies which would be below the trailing 20 year trend.
花旗观点：期货市场定价低于公允价值。花旗观察到很多市场开始对明年下半年收缩，同时更低价格的影响已经充分过滤到了生产侧。发达国家经济增长保持温和态势，花旗预测全球经济增长略低于3%。美国之外的发达国家将不得不努力焕发08年以来几乎停滞的经济活力。花旗预测直到2017年大多数工业国不到2%的经济增长，低于近20年趋势（ma？）
 
3.* US Rates Strategy Focus - 2016 Outlook 
https://www.citivelocity.com/t/eppublic/umOd
 
- Rates Forecast – We expect rates to end up lower than forwards in 2016. The biggest risk to our forecasts is a sustained increase in global reflation fears led by commodity prices moving higher, in the second half of 2016.
利率前瞻——我们预计利率2016年最终会比远期低一些。我们预测的最大风险在于商品价格在2016后半段见底后走高导致的通货再膨胀可能。
- US Treasury Supply Forecast - Expect a modest decline in front-end coupon auction sizes in 2016 while T-bills outstanding might increase. Gross coupon issuance is forecast to remain close to unchanged but we expect net coupon issuance to fall from $625 billion to $186 billion.
美国国债供应预测—预计2016内短端供给温和下降，存量长端可能有所增加。总发行量可能不太会变，但净发行量可能从$625bn降至$186bn
- Repo Clear - Large parts of repo financing will likely migrate off of dealer balance sheets and onto central counterparty clearing (CCP). The eventual move could potentially increase Treasury market liquidity and widen swap spreads.
 回购集中清算——大量的回购融资将从交易商的资产负债表迁移到中央交易对手的上去。这最终将增加t的流动性，展宽swap点差（I doubt。看看ccp能不能做得更好啦）。
4.这段话特别有启发性，很多时候就是这样，一语成谶（chen）
 
I have 400 client meetings every year and see clients all over the world and I hear many kinds of views on what the Fed should do and what the Fed should not do. Some clients think the Fed should have hiked in 2014 to prevent future financial instability. Others think the Fed should not have raised rates in 2015 because we have not yet seen the white of the eyes of inflation. With such divergent views about monetary policy in the market it is interesting how united the FOMC has been in their views about policy during the year of liftoff, see chart below. As the Fed raises rates at a turtle speed in 2016 I believe we will see a decline in the standard deviation of the views in the market. In other words, instead of focusing intensely on minor tail risks more investors will come around to the view that the economy is moving closer and closer to full capacity and that is why the Fed needs to push rates higher. 
我每年大约有400个客户会议，遍及全球，会听到fed该做和不该做什么的种种观点。有些客户认为fed2014年就该加息以阻止未来的金融不稳定。也有客户认为fed2015就不该加息，因为通胀的影子都没见着呢。就货币政策观点的差异而言，在今年这个加息的年份，看看fomc成员的意见是如何一致起来的就比较有意思了，如下图。2016fed龟速加息的当下，我认为我们将看到市场上预期的方差下降（不好好说话，意思是大家观点会比较一致）。换句话说，投资者不再关注细微的尾部风险（加与不加算尾部哇），而是就经济越来越接近全速增长导致fed推高利息这个结论达成共识。（2016的波动源泉还是围绕加息进程来的）
 
职业背景 | More »
Deutsche Bank AG
Mng Dir/Chief International Economist
Present
 
Org for Economic Coop & Dev
Economist
06/2002-09/2005
 
Intl Monetary Fund
10/1998-05/2002
教育
 
Princeton University
University of Copenhagen
 
5、
游走于义利灵界的魅影
 
 读《资本之王——全球私募之王黑石帝国成长史》有感
 
 
 
    当下最热门的新闻莫过于查理.辛的经年丑事了。各种狗血不一而足。首先是外媒RadarOnline报道称，某位好莱坞男星确诊为HIV阳性，报道中的描述令很多人猜测该男星为查理·辛。周一，以揭露名人八卦著称的《国家询问报》(National Enquirer)称查理·辛已经确诊为HIV阳性。《人物》杂志也采访到一位好莱坞著名的公关人士霍华德·布拉格曼，他表示查理·辛身边的人曾经就如何处理这一状况接触过他。布拉格曼说：“这事我已经知道很久了，我并不惊讶。”他还提到，就他所知查理·辛已经开始接受相关治疗，“他身边的很多人都知道此事。终于在11月17日查理·辛做客《Today Show》承认自己四年前就已经确认HIV阳性，他表示曾在患病后被身边人勒索上百万美元，特别强调并否认将病毒传给其他人，称自己有使用安全措施。
     总之各种不拉不拉。这里其实想说得是他早期的一部佳作-《华尔街》。在这部完成于1987年的作品中，虽然最终是老道的迈克尔.道格拉斯技高一筹，因本片获得了第60届奥斯卡最佳男主角奖，但是一如风华正茂的查理.辛俊俏的外貌一样，很多观众还是对他留下了深刻印象。本来这部电影是大导演导演奥利弗·斯通继《野战排》的反战主题以后，以一个白领股票新手的视觉为切入点，拍摄的抨击和揭露资本主义经济制度下的贪欲罪恶的电影。但正如当下风头正热的美国总统候选人，富豪Donald Trump，就曾在他的自传中说的那样“很简单，金钱对他的吸引力已经不太大了，他更多的动机是为了参与这种挑战并且成为赢家”，片中主角戈登（道格拉斯扮演）在华尔街呼风唤雨，竭尽金融大鳄之能事，实现了较强的self-fulfillment的意味，则着实起了不少反面作用。电影公映后的第三年，甚至《新闻周刊》杂志封面出现了一个这样的问题：“贪婪死了吗？”（Is Greed Dead?）多年来，电影的编剧斯坦利·韦瑟遇到过许多人告诉自己，“这部电影改变了我的一生。我一看到就知道自己想要从事这个行业。我希望成为像哥顿·盖柯（那样的人）”。除此以外，查理·辛和迈克尔·道格拉斯也不断有遇到他人表示自己正是因为对方在电影中扮演的角色而成为股票经济人。可怜的查林，虽然那时很年轻，很英俊，但无论是卖力的演出，还是剧终他自首并揭发组织老板的做派，恐怕都不会想到这样的反作用力。
    而片中反应的大反派（虽然很多人学他并前仆后继）的操作手法正是黑石集团发家发展强大的不二法门——寻找整体价值小于分拆价值的公司，买下，分拆，卖掉，获利。就是这样凶猛！1986年，就是在电影完成的前一年，“收购并出售”行当的翘楚KKR对一家美国连锁超市西夫韦展开了收购。根据后来《华尔街日报》的报道，这一收购行动导致了63,000名西夫韦的经理和工人因商店出售或解雇离开了公司。接近60%的员工在被裁一年后仍未找到工作。甚至有一位在达拉斯微西夫韦当了30年的卡车司机的詹姆斯.怀特先生在离职一年后绝望得自杀了。这些场景我们都可以轻松地在电影中找到类似的桥段，包括后来1990年该连锁超市重新上市后，KK公司和西夫韦管理层获得了4倍于投资的回报。从经济的角度看，虽然我们不仅仅是经济动物，西夫韦公司收购的完整历史证明，这一类行动可能是经济运行中内生式自发调节。随着资产出售、成本削减及新的激励措施这些要在几年后才会显现强大影响力措施的实施，西夫韦实现了脱胎换骨的变化。在被收购后的第三年（1989），经营利润率达到3.2%，较1985年的2.2%水平上涨了三分之一。而更富有远见和魄力的是，收购方KKR公司在1990年该公司IPO之后，连续持股西夫韦不动长达10年之久，直到2000年将发行价为2.81美元的股票于62美元高位抛现，最终实现了约50倍的收益。除去KKR财务上的成功不谈，这一类收购行为的成功传递了一个全新时代的开端：通过不断灌输投资效率的观念，促进了整个经济的发展。资本市场不再追捧那些效率低下、整合摩擦大于协整效应的公司，而是迫使公司管理层努力消除不利影响，使得敌意收购者和收购企业越来越难以找到下手机会。显然这其中，务必是有一点创造价值的意味的。
    儒家不是禁欲主义，承认欲望，承认功利，但不以功利为最高目标，要超越功利。义利之辩，在义和利之间，更强调义。义者利之和，有着利益冲突的人之间达成的均衡就是义。从当代新古典经济学讲开，自由自愿的交易最有效率。如果不是自由交易，定价就不在均衡点上，交易量也不均衡，不是有过剩就是有短缺。在这个基础上，人们为了自己的利益最大化，社会就会导向效率更高的结果，比如说，分工和专业化的结果。如果是一个奉行经济自由的社会，它的分工会越来越细化，专业化程度越来越高。这样我们来看，KKR之类的资本市场狼性十足的机构至少在西夫韦这类企业的并购过程中，实现自身利益的同时，也推进了微观上社会资源调配的效率和改良。1993年上映的电影《侏罗纪公园》中有这么一句台词，“Life will find its way!(生命会自行找到出路！,差不多这个翻译吧）”。当时是艾伦与蕾克丝到达悬崖底下后冒险上树救了受伤的提姆，在第二天开始往游客中心进发，却在期间发现了恐龙繁殖过后的蛋，艾伦感到十分震惊，于是推论出恐龙在DNA繁殖的情况下自行产生的双性DNA使得公园的恐龙可以自行变性，也应验了伊恩所说过的这么一句话。也许我们人类的社会也就是在个体追求利益的合力作用下，不断地在寻找出路吧。
 
 

--------------------------------

Article No. 291
1229-30合发
2015-12-30 随手札记

1、ECB’s Mersch Says QE Will Run ‘as Long as Necessary,’ IBF Says
 
(Bloomberg) -- European Central Bank Executive Board member Yves Mersch says in
pre-release of an interview with International Bankers Forum that policy makers
‘have by no means used up all our ammunition.’’
“We can add-on any time, should this be necessary. We still have ammunition and
firepower”
Ecb执委Yves Mersch 在近期发布的一次在世界银行家协会的访谈中说，政策制定者们将会竭尽全力，有额外的时间，只要有必要，还是有弹药和火力的“
On asset purchases, says “the program will run as long as necessary to reach
our goal sustainably”
在资产购买方面，他说“该计划将持续知道目标稳定住”
On deposit rate, says “theoretically, the current minus 0.3 percent doesn’t
have to be the lower bound”
在存款利率方面，他说“理论上，当前负0.3%并不是更低的下限”
NOTE: Full interview to be published on Dec. 29
欧洲经济还不错啊，不知名这位发狠话是什么个意思？（Yves Mersch is a Luxembourgian jurist and lawyer who served as Governor of the Central Bank of 
Luxembourg from the bank's formation in 1998 until 2012 and as a member of the Executive 
Board of the European Central Bank since 2012.）
 
2、** CFTC on UST Futures (for the week ended 22 Dec)

cash equivalents.

*Spes increased their net shorts in ED futs by 196K contracts to 314K contracts, their highest since Dec 2014. Specs also increased their net shorts in TU and WN futs by 19K & 9K contracts, respectively.
Ed的投机净空头增加196k合约到314k涨，创2014年12月以来新高。投机性净空头还分别增加了TU（2yr期货）和WN（30yr期货） 19k和9k。

但是，投机性头寸周末降低了12k合约的FV（5yr）

3、Overnight UST/EGB Commentary 欧洲和美国时间1228日间
 
The German curve bull-flattened on Monday, in very thin volumes and illiquid year-end market conditions, driven by the slide in oil and the weakness in global equities following the sell-off in Chinese equities overnight. Very light flows.
周一德国曲线牛平，成交量稀少，年末流动性很差，受油价下跌和全球股市跟随中国股市走弱影响。客盘很轻。
The b/c of the 2y US auction in the US fell to 2.80, the lowest level since aug 2009. Indirects were weak (37.5%, lowest this year) but directs were strong (27%, most since December 2013).
2yr国债拍卖认购倍数降至2.80，为2009年8月以来最低。间接买盘（客盘经由交易商下单，包括共同基金和外国央行）弱（37.5%，年内最低），直接（22个一级国债交易商）则强（27%，2013年12月以来最大）。
 
 
4、ust 美国时间段，another house
A very quiet day today with the markets driven by the long end futures and cash. The richening in US and WN again led to the bull flattening of the curve,as did the underperformance of crude. We also saw domestic real money buying of bonds in the morning’s move up. The afternoon was  met the real money 2-way hence some volatility of bonds on today’s low liquidity.
平静的一天，市场主要由长端期货和现券驱动。Us现券和超长期期货走高导致曲线牛平，而原油萎靡。我们还看到境内真钱早盘上涨中买入。下午真钱则有双向交易，那么低流动性下债券交易些许波动
 
 
1、ust color 美国时间
 
Over the past few days the curve flattening happened on flows and low liquidity, and today it’s steepened out from support levels around 122bps.Throughout the day we saw fast money selling of 30s and 10s, though in the afternoon there was once again domestic real money buying of 30s, and the belly. Otherwise, the market kept track with stocks and oil as usual. The 5y auction tailed 1.8bps on risk aversion and lack of ability for dealers to hold the supply. For example, the WI 5y roll cheapened .75bps from pre-auction to end of day levels—highlighting the pressures on balance sheet. Going into the 7y auction tomorrow we would also expect a bit of a concession and the roll to cheapen, but may see more players given the level of yields and today’s tail.
在过去几天，曲线在客盘驱动和低流动性条件下走平，而今天则在122bps（3yr?）支撑位走陡了。全天快钱都在卖出30yr和10yr，尽管下午国内真钱有买入30s和曲线中段。此外，债市还是和往常一样延续股市和原油走势（反向）。在风险反转和交易商吃不下发行量的情况下，5yr拍卖尾盘涨1.8bps。比如，5年期利率期货滚单从拍卖前到交易日结束跌0.75bps——表明了交易商资产负债表的压力。至于明天7ye拍卖，我们同样预期会有点萧条，滚单还是会便宜一些，但从今天的收益水平和今天尾盘的表现（这个交易员可能认为短期回调到位，且尾盘有抢单），有可能看到更多的参与者
 
 2s    1.093  +3.9 bps
 5s    1.782  +6.7 bps
 10s   2.307  +8.3 bps
 30s   3.040  +10.2 bps
 TYH6          125-212
 
2、NY SALES REPORT - Retailers facing many unhappy returns?零售商问题多多
 
 精华在最后两段
Overview
 
We remain deeply entrenched in holiday mode but that is not stopping some decent volatility. US yields moved steadily and substantially higher on the day boosted by decent US retail sales reports, a sharp rebound in labor market indicators (jobs plentiful), further equity gains, a poor 5 year Treasury auction and rebounding commodity prices. WTI fell sharply yesterday but rebounded today and copper rose 3 pct as well on signs Chinese smelters had agreed to cut their sales of copper.  However despite widening interest rate differentials, the eurusd could not sustain under 1.0900 but the usd was generally well supported except against commodity currencies. GBP fell to a 1.4786 low which was its lowest level since April 2015. The S&P rallied over 1 pct and has now recorded 11 days with a 1 pct move over the last 20 trading days. Retailers share prices seemed to have a relief rally and the S&P trying to get back to flat for the month. Despite the news, Usdjpy could not move out of a 27 pip range and peaked at 120.51.
 虽然我们还沉沁的节日气氛中，可还是波动不断。美债收益上升，受良好零售数据、就业数据大幅反弹（岗位充足）、上市公司盈利增加、5yrT拍卖不理想和大宗价格反弹等一系列因素影响再上一大台阶。昨天WTI暴跌今天反弹，铜涨3%得益于中国厂商达成协议降低销量。但是尽管利率差别越来越大，eurusd不太可能维持住在1.09以下，尽管美元对那些商品国家货币是有强支撑的（欧元要涨？Usd/em要涨？）。GBP跌到1.4786,2015年4月来低点。Sp涨超1%，在过去20个交易日里有11天涨或跌超1%。零售股价格看起来无量上涨，sp本月有望收平。不考虑消息层面，usdjpy在27pips范围内窄幅波动，高点为120.51.
The day
 The weekend press noted that with Xmas day on a Friday for the first time in a decade, having an extra weekend this year, should boost retail activity. Although others noted that returns from on-line purchases can run as high as 20 pct of sales. Still on the day, retailer stocks were encouraged by the MasterCard report that U.S. holiday retail sales grow a 'solid' 7.9 pct: Amazon was up $18 to $693 which is a new high for 2015 for a mere 123 pct ytd return and a PE of 372…
周末新闻说圣诞节适逢周末是十年来首次，将极大刺激零售。尽管有人说电商回报高达20%,但实体店股票受maser关于美国假日销售强劲增长7.9%消息提振。Amazon涨18usd至693，创2015年内新高，年回报13%，pe372.....
 
The Saudi budget was delivered yesterday and research debated how much would actual spending in 2016 diverge from the 2016 budget of USD224bn (historically the former has run at 25%+ vs. budgeted). With revenue projected at USD137bn, if Saudi indeed manages to stay within budget it would imply a 2016 deficit of USD87bn or 13% of GDP or as much as USD140bn or 21% of GDP if they continues to overspend. Despite the bounce in oil Saudi 1-mo. forward points are at 65.00, highest since 2008 GFC.
沙特昨日公布2016预算，各方研究就2016预算的224bn到底能花多少钱争执不休（历史来看实际花费比预算为25%+？自行脑补一下那帮白袍子家伙的日子吧）。收入预算为137bn，如果沙特实打实花那么多，2016赤字就会高达87bn或GDP的13%，换句话就是多花250bn或GDP的21%。原油反弹之外，沙特1月后原油的远期价格加65点（wti和brent都是contago，wti三月比二月高1刀左右），为危机以来最高（油价要涨！）。
 
The eurusd was around 1.0970 on the NY open but quickly came under pressure and moved down through 1.0930 as GBP wobbled. Our e-desk noted LHS interest in EUR/USD  from European banks and Real Money accounts.  Additionally, EUR crosses were sold, specifically EUR/CE3 from models. GBP looked under 1.48 for the first time since April. Option turnover on DTCC remains so light and if there was any action, it is in JPY and JPY crosses. Demand for usdjpy downside strikes under 120 for early Jan in favor.
Ny时段Eurusd 围绕1.0970波动，很快和GBP一道受压跌穿1.0930。我们的电子台注意到欧洲银行真钱经由网络发来的对eurusd的兴趣。此外，eur各个品种对都是卖盘，尤其是从模型看ce3（欧元加拿大元外汇期货）。GBP看上去是4月份以来首次在1.48以下。DTCC数据表明期权展期寥寥，即便有，也是集中在JPY和jpy在内的币种对。对usdjpy执行价低于低于120且行权日在1月早些时候的很受欢迎。
 
On the data front, the advanced goods trade balance came as expected at 60.5bn.  Imports fell 1.8% and exports fell 2% in Nov. Shiller home prices rose 0.8 pct for 5.5 pct yoy and showed housing prices are holding up.  Some 360k of multifamily dwellings were built in 2014 which was apparently a 20 year high but yet to impact rents. Press reports noted the number of upper end apartments built in Manhattan in recent years seems to be having an impact on prices as the pool of high end buyers is shrinking.
 
WTI dropped 3 pct yesterday but rallied back today and both oil up and stocks were up again. In 2015, oil and stocks both fell on the same day 85 days. That equaled the same number of days in 2012. Still both fell more than 50 pct of days in 2015, so really a random walk.
 
US yields moved steadily higher with 5 year supply and the US 2 year up to 1.07 pct from 0.55 pct in mid October. US consumer confidence rose to 96.5 against an expected 93.5 but the best news was Jobs hard to get falling to 24.7 from 25.8 and plentiful back to near cyclical highs (see ratio chart below).  The 10 year moved over 2.30 pct and its range for 2015 was a mere 84 bps from 2.48 to 1.64 pct. Still the better news contrasted with Dallas Fed manufacturing which was appalling yesterday at -20 and many press reports of capital spending plans being slashed in energy sector in 2016.  Although some arguing that the US fiscal spending plans could boost 2016 GDP by as much as 0.7 pct now.
 
 
 
Eurusd dropped to 1.0909 low this morning. This was about the extent of a big range these days at 0.80 pct. There has been some corp. demand for usd but eurusd not showing as much momentum as you might have expected.  Still the bounce was limited and we traded down to 1.0899 and EBS aggressor eurusd supply during NY hours was around -1bn. The S&P rally was steady and it closed Nov at 2080.4 and trying to get back to flat for the month of December. The last two years, S&P has dropped 3 pct in Jan... and what will it do in 2016.  S&P has not been able to spend more than 1 day above the 200 day moving average since 7 dec and back above today...
 
Eursek moved down to 9.1445 and had its lowest close since March 2015. SEK longs are growing in popularity.
 
Meanwhile the news in Canada remains disappointing. DB's Galy notes consumer confidence and expectations continue to drop (see chart) as housing and the labour market are starting to worry consumers. Expectations of a drop in house price have been on a steady rise.  The US/Canada 2 year spread is now out to 59 bps which is the widest since 2007 and was basically flat in mid October. Keep buying any dips in usdcad towards 1.3600 and the 5 year forward points are now out to 400 bps.
 
The US 5 year auction came at 1.785 pct and 5 year yields moved towards their highs for the year... and very close to their highest levels since 2011...
 
 
 
 
 
The afternoon session saw eurusd bounce from 1.0899 back to 1.0936. It is a little disappointing given US yields are moving higher and German repo fell to record low -51.9bp from -46.1bp, -26.1bp 3 mos. Ago.  Euro repo rate falls to record low -35.1bp from -34.5bp, -22bp 3 months ago. So Fed fund expectations back to their highest level in months for end 2016 (see chart below) and US/German 2 year spread is now 143 bps which is even wider than pre ECB pricing.
 
S&P up 1 pct ytd and energy stocks actually lagged on the day and WTI held $40 for many months and will not be easily broken in 2016
 
Other news
There seemed to be some tax loss selling of currency hedged ETFS. One report noted the Wisdom Tree Europe Hedged Equity Fund market value has fallen to $17 billion from more than $22 billion as recently as August (more losses than outflows?). In the first four months of the year, traders poured $13 billion in the ETF, making it the favorite bet on European equities. However DB’s Winkler noted that we still a long way to go for a full un-wind of inflows to hedged ETFs in Q1… (See chart below)
 
 
 
    
Trump Says He Will ‘Spend Big’ in Iowa, N.H., S.C. -   “My campaign for president is $35m under budget, I have spent very little (and am in 1st place). Now I will spend BIG.
Germany's federal states are planning to spend around 17 bn on dealing with the refugee crisis in 2016, reported Die Welt. That is bigger than the 15.3bn that the central govt planned to allocate to its education and research ministry in 2015. The Association of German Cities called for a large-scale home building programme for refugees many of whom have been sleeping in school gymnasiums, office blocks and tents. Germany is the favored destination partly due to its generous benefits. Actual costs would probably be even higher because the regional finance ministries
S&P closed flat on the year in 2011 and this year has been remarkable similar in the price action
 
 
 
 
 
Conclusion
 
After the poor 5 year auction and stronger data, US 10 year now 2.31 pct and equities up over 1 pct. Would be inclined to be leaning short eurusd here but the next 5 days will bring a lot of unfriendly US manufacturing data. Dallas manufacturing was the second lowest reading since 2008 and in the next week, we will see Chicago PMI and ISM. However expect ADP and NFP will surely bring more positive news.
 5yr拍卖预冷，数据强劲，us10yr现在2.31%，股票涨1%。要继续做空eurusd吗？未来5天将会有很多不太好的us工业数据。达拉斯制造业可是2008年来第二低了，下周还有chiago和ism的PMI。但是还是期望adp和nfp会正面

3、股市近期可能受压的原因之一
China Seen Ending Share Sale Ban That Drew Foreign Fund Scorn
 
China Seen Ending Share Sale Ban That Drew Foreign Fund Scorn
-Six-month restriction on equity sales set to expire next week
-Small-cap shares most vulnerable to sell-off, analysts say
 
China stock investors are about to find out whether a budding equities recovery can cope with the end of a sales ban that’s kept an estimated $185 billion of shares off the market.

4、us经济述评一篇——重要——解释ml为什么会警告us明年可能衰退？
The "final" snapshot of Q3 corporate profits showed a 5.1% year-over-year decline, lending credence to our supposition that profit margins likely peaked one year ago. In our view, the best way to measure profit margins is to take total economy-wide corporate profits as measured in the GDP accounts and divide them by the level of private employment. This way, we have hard dollar values of how much each worker produces for the economy and we are capturing the entire economy, including the corporate and labor sides of the ledger. We use pre-tax corporate profits with inventory and capital consumption adjustments, because this is the broadest measure of operating profits, with history dating back to 1947. As shown in the chart below, profits per worker have trended noticeably higher over time, due to productivity gains and inflation. In the current business cycle, margins peaked at $18,390 per worker in Q3 2014, but have since declined by 7.3% to $17,045 per worker in Q3 2015. Margins have fallen mainly because corporate profits have declined—job growth in the above period was just 2.3%.
Q3公司利润最终快照表明了5.1%yoy下降，支持了我们关于利润空间一年前见顶的结论。我们认为，最佳度量利润空间的方式是加总GDP统计中整个经济中的公司利润除以私营雇佣水平。这样，我们就得到每个工人为经济发展创造的真实的美元价值，因而掌握整个经济状况，包括公司和劳动力市场两个总账层面。我们采用经存货和资本消费调整的税前公司利润，因为这是最广泛应用的度量运营利润的方法，从1947年就开始了。正如下图所示，单个个人利润显著随时间增长，因为产能增长和通胀原因。在当前商业周期内，边际收入在2014Q3达到18,390的峰值，在之后一路下跌7.3%到2015Q3的17,045。这主要是因为公司利润下降，因为工作岗位只增长了2.3%。
Profit margins always peak in advance of recession. Indeed, there has not been one business cycle in the post-WWII era in which this has not been the case. The reason is simple: When corporate profitability declines, a pullback in spending and hiring eventually ensues. Normally, margins compress because of cost pressures—the labor share of income rises relative to the corporate share
of income. Put another way, when companies compete for scarce resources (labor), worker pay is bid up. In turn, inflation pressures often surface, and the Fed begins raising interest rates, sometimes aggressively.
边际利润总是领先于衰退。事实上，ww2之后还没有任何一个经济周期能够逃脱这个现象。原因很简单：当公司盈利能力下降，肯定最终会降低支出和雇佣。名义上，边际受压是因为成本原因——劳动力成本相对于公司收入上涨。换句话就是，当公司竞争稀缺资源（劳动力），工人工资就会上涨。结果，通胀压力显现，fed就开始加息，有时还会很激进地加息。
On the surface, the peak in margins may unsettle some investors, because historically the average and median lead times between the peak in margins and the onset of recession have been eight and nine quarters, respectively. This would imply that the economy could enter recession in the second half of next year. However, it is imperative to note that the lead time from the peak in margins to the beginning of recessions varies substantially across business cycles, and longer business cycles tend to have longer lead times. For example,16 and 15 quarters, respectively, before recession. Moreover, monetary policy is extremely accommodative, and that is likely to remain the case given the fact that inflation remains very low.
表明上，边际利润见顶会吓退部分投资者，因为历史上看边际利润峰值和衰退开始之间的平均及中位领先季度数分别为8和9.这就意味着经济可能将于明年下半年进入衰退。但是，不得不指出的是不同经济周期内从边际见顶到衰退开始的季度数差别很大，更长的经济周一会有更长的领先时间。例如，在衰退前分别16和15个季度。此外，货币政策也是极有弹性的，在通胀持续低迷的情况下，很可能也会这样（领先周期会很长）
 
5、亚洲时间日评（14:45,明天日本假日）
 
Treasuries are 1 to 2bps richer on day after a sell-off during NY session. Equities were little changed (Nikkei +0.1%, Shanghai +0.1% and S&P -0.1%) while oil retraced some of the gains (-$0.65, at $37.2 at the time of writing). Flows were definitely a bit more active compared to the last couple of sessions, we saw better buying from RM accounts in the belly to long-end. Curve was roughly unchanged while 5s somewhat richened on the curve (2s5s10s -0.9bps). Good volumes going through so far with 1.5x to 3.5x in cash and futures, with cash 7s the most active at 4.5x.
T涨1-2bps，继ny时段抛盘汹涌。股市微平（日经+0.1%，上海0.1%，spx-0.1%）,原油回吐部分涨幅（-0.65,37.2）。相对前几个时段，客盘好点儿了。真钱在中段至长端买盘有所起色。曲线没咋变，5s不知怎么的涨了点儿（2s5s10s -0.9bps）。截至目前，量不错，现货和期货都有1.5倍和3.5倍的量，7s现货成交最活跃，达4.5倍。
European data calendar looks light today with no tier-1 data to be released. Italy will be auctioning 5y, 7y and 10y paper. Out of the U.S., we have Pending Home Sales along with 7y supply.
欧洲数据日历今天没啥重要数据，意大利今天拍卖5y7y和10y国债。美国呢，待定房屋销售（可能有惊喜）和7yr拍卖。
USD Rates trading will be closed tomorrow for Japanese bank holiday. We will open at 0700 London / 1600 Tokyo / 0200 New York.
美元利率交易明天将因日本假日关闭。我们将于伦敦时间0700/东京时间1600/纽约时间0200回来。
